verses.verse: Woe <WH1945> to them that go down<WH3381> to Egypt<WH4714> for help;<WH5833> and stay<WH8172> on<WH5921> horses,<WH5483> and trust<WH982> in<WH5921> chariots,<WH7393> because<WH3588> they are many;<WH7227> and in<WH5921> horsemen,<WH6571> because<WH3588> they are very strong;<WH6105> <WH3966> but they look<WH8159> not<WH3808> unto<WH5921> the Holy One<WH6918> of Israel,<WH3478> neither<WH3808> seek<WH1875> the LORD!<WH3068>

Yet he<WH1931> also<WH1571> is wise,<WH2450> and will bring<WH935> evil,<WH7451> and will not<WH3808> call back<WH5493> his words:<WH1697> but will arise<WH6965> against<WH5921> the house<WH1004> of the evildoers,<WH7489> and against<WH5921> the help<WH5833> of them that work<WH6466> iniquity.<WH205>

Now the Egyptians<WH4714> are men,<WH120> and not<WH3808> God;<WH410> and their horses<WH5483> flesh,<WH1320> and not<WH3808> spirit.<WH7307> When the LORD<WH3068> shall stretch out<WH5186> his hand,<WH3027> both he that helpeth<WH5826> shall fall,<WH3782> and he that is helped<WH5826> shall fall down,<WH5307> and they all<WH3605> shall fail<WH3615> together.<WH3162>

For <WH3588> thus<WH3541> hath the LORD<WH3068> spoken<WH559> unto<WH413> me, Like as<WH834> the lion<WH738> and the young lion<WH3715> roaring<WH1897> on<WH5921> his prey,<WH2964> when<WH834> a multitude<WH4393> of shepherds<WH7462> is called forth<WH7121> against<WH5921> him, he will not<WH3808> be afraid<WH2865> of their voice,<WH4480> <WH6963> nor<WH3808> abase<WH6031> himself for the noise<WH4480> <WH1995> of them: so<WH3651> shall the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> come down<WH3381> to fight<WH6633> for<WH5921> mount<WH2022> Zion,<WH6726> and for<WH5921> the hill<WH1389> thereof.

As birds<WH6833> flying,<WH5774> so<WH3651> will the LORD<WH3068> of hosts<WH6635> defend<WH1598> <WH5921> Jerusalem;<WH3389> defending<WH1598> also he will deliver<WH5337> it; and passing over<WH6452> he will preserve<WH4422> it.
Turn <WH7725> ye unto him from whom<WH834> the children<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> have deeply<WH6009> revolted.<WH5627>

For <WH3588> in that<WH1931> day<WH3117> every man<WH376> shall cast away<WH3988> his idols<WH457> of silver,<WH3701> and his idols<WH457> of gold,<WH2091> which<WH834> your own hands<WH3027> have made<WH6213> unto you for a sin.<WH2399>

Then shall the Assyrian<WH804> fall<WH5307> with the sword,<WH2719> not<WH3808> of a mighty man;<WH376> and the sword,<WH2719> not<WH3808> of a mean man,<WH120> shall devour<WH398> him: but he shall flee<WH5127> from<WH4480> <WH6440> the sword,<WH2719> and his young men<WH970> shall be<WH1961> discomfited.<WH4522>

And he shall pass over<WH5674> to his stronghold<WH5553> for fear,<WH4480> <WH4032> and his princes<WH8269> shall be afraid<WH2865> of the ensign,<WH4480> <WH5251> saith<WH5002> the LORD,<WH3068> whose<WH834> fire<WH217> is in Zion,<WH6726> and his furnace<WH8574> in Jerusalem.<WH3389>
